subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} – hand and fingers. The top stroke is the bent over middle finger, while the horizontal strokes are each two fingers. Compare {{zh-l|*爪}}, {{zh-l|*寸}}, {{zh-l|*九}}.

Note that unlike the other hand/claw characters, {{lang|zh|手}} has consistently had five fingers: a mammalian/human hand, as opposed to the three digits often found in the others.

Compare also {{zh-l|*止|foot}}, derived from a footprint, originally composed of 3 toes and a sole.
